<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass performs the following transformation on LLVM IR level required</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for the following translation to SPIR-V:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - replaces direct usages of aggregate constants with target-specific</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   intrinsics;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - replaces aggregates-related instructions (extract/insert, ld/st, etc)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   with a target-specific intrinsics;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - emits intrinsics for the global variable initializers since IRTranslator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   doesn&#39;t handle them and it&#39;s not very convenient to translate them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ourselves;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - emits intrinsics to keep track of the string names assigned to the values;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - emits intrinsics to keep track of constants (this is necessary to have an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   LLVM IR constant after the IRTranslation is completed) for their further</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   deduplication;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - emits intrinsics to keep track of original LLVM types of the values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   to be able to emit proper SPIR-V types eventually.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: consider removing spv.track.constant in favor of spv.assign.type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// look for known basic patterns of type inference</span></CodeLine>
